No holding back at East Coast station Puketoro’s cattle and sheep salehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/no-holding-back-at-east-coast-station-puketoros-cattle-and-sheep-sale/HLUM6Q35VRDJZCQDNRGCGCUE7M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/no-holding-back-at-east-coast-station-puketoros-cattle-and-sheep-sale/HLUM6Q35VRDJZCQDNRGCGCUE7M/ Murray RobertsonBuyers 'did not hold back' in their bidding, says auctioneer. Thu, 09 Jan 2025 03:03:35 +0000 The on-farm sheep and cattle auction at East Coast station Puketoro on Wednesday was highly successful, according to auctioneer Shane Scott (pictured) from Central Livestock.
Gisborne sewer blockage clearance on hold pending Friday decision https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-sewer-blockage-clearance-on-hold-pending-friday-decision/G2CZGO5UGNGBFGMEBL6KVWGGCE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-sewer-blockage-clearance-on-hold-pending-friday-decision/G2CZGO5UGNGBFGMEBL6KVWGGCE/ Murray RobertsonThe council says work to clear the blockage has cost $25,000 so far. Thu, 09 Jan 2025 03:02:43 +0000 No activity on the water at the confluence of Gisborne city rivers Taruheru, Waimata and Tūranganui on Friday afternoon. In the background are waka stacked up at the Marina. This number will be significantly reduced as local paddlers head to Lake Karapiro for the Waka Ama Sprint Nationals, starting on Sunday. Training was curtailed by health warning signs going up after the district council had to open the emergency sewer valve at the Oak St pump station earlier this week, discharging raw sewage into Taruheru River, after a sewer pipe backed up due to green waste being put into a manhole on a Mangapapa property.
Coromandel: DoC ‘dismayed’ after reports of seabirds captured in fishing nets and drowned by boaties https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/coromandel-doc-dismayed-after-reports-of-seabirds-captured-in-fishing-nets-and-drowned-by-boaties/BXRALTJ7NBCNHLOTAZWJBKOS7A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/coromandel-doc-dismayed-after-reports-of-seabirds-captured-in-fishing-nets-and-drowned-by-boaties/BXRALTJ7NBCNHLOTAZWJBKOS7A/ Al Williams'Extremely frustrating and distressing to hear about this kind of wilful mistreatment.' Thu, 09 Jan 2025 02:44:22 +0000 The incident was reported to have happened about 12pm on Friday, January 3 near Slipper Island in the Coromandel. The island is located about 3km east of Pauanui.
LA fires: New Zealanders, including consul-general, among evacuees from Los Angeles https://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/la-fires-new-zealanders-include-consul-general-among-evacuees-from-los-angeles/6MHLGRAA3VCY3LNVAQRDNRUTL4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/la-fires-new-zealanders-include-consul-general-among-evacuees-from-los-angeles/6MHLGRAA3VCY3LNVAQRDNRUTL4/ There are 18 New Zealanders currently registered as being in Los Angeles, MFAT says. Thu, 09 Jan 2025 02:41:25 +0000 Police officers remove an elderly resident from her home during the Eaton fire in Altadena, California. Photo / AFP

Tokoroa water incident: One person airlifted to Waikato Hospital in critical condition https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/tokoroa-water-incident-one-person-airlifted-to-waikato-hospital-in-ritic-condition/P5YR5IO4FJFNTNAMLJQSCJDK2A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/tokoroa-water-incident-one-person-airlifted-to-waikato-hospital-in-ritic-condition/P5YR5IO4FJFNTNAMLJQSCJDK2A/ Maryana GarciaOne rapid response unit and one helicopter responded to the incident this afternoon. Thu, 09 Jan 2025 02:22:40 +0000 One ambulance, one rapid response unit and one helicopter responded to a “water incident” reported in Tokoroa.
Gisborne drive-through event makes immunisation more accessible https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-drive-through-event-makes-immunise-more-accessible/WJQPK2U5BFHK5J34Z7ZAYJ7THI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-drive-through-event-makes-immunise-more-accessible/WJQPK2U5BFHK5J34Z7ZAYJ7THI/ Pinnacle and Tūranga Health collaborated on the event for Gisborne pēpī and tamariki. Thu, 09 Jan 2025 02:00:00 +0000 Cassandra Sheridan, a registered Tamariki Ora nurse with Tūranga Health, stands on the steps of Piki te Ora, the mobile camper bringing immunisation services directly to whānau in Tairāwhiti.

Gisborne cars set to launch powerhouse challenge at NZ Superstock Champshttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-cars-set-to-launch-powerhouse-challenge-at-nz-superstock-champs/MB4P5QREDNG5LKXRJ6JTQ3JUXY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-cars-set-to-launch-powerhouse-challenge-at-nz-superstock-champs/MB4P5QREDNG5LKXRJ6JTQ3JUXY/ Murray Robertson'We are all ready to race': reigning champ Asher Rees. He is pictured celebrating a win on the Awapuni Speedway track last summer. Photo / Liam Clayton
